page.title: 18FOOTPATHS
page.content: The Parish Council had{complaints} from farmers and ramblers about the footpaths. They formed a footpath sub- committee. It asked the advice of the M.P. the county council, the ramblers and the National Union of Farmers.They decided to realign some footpaths. The {problem}was that people were going through fields destroying crops and through farmyards. Previously footpaths had been{used}for going to church and to work but now they are being used as a leisure activity by people from the towns. The sub-committee had visited 42 farmers in this area. The farmers have to pay for the legal process of{changing}the route of the footpaths but the walkers do not have to pay.Local{footpaths}may be overgrown, bridges and stiles are broken or missing, paths may be obstructed by mud or barbed wire.
